metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2432 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability Oracle the MySQL Server component 5.5.35 andearlier and 5.6.15 and earlier allows remote authenticated users to affectavailability via unknown vectors related to Federated.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2432` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient18 - 5.5.37-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libmysqld-pic - 5.5.37-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client - 5.5.37-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-5.5 - 5.5.37-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.37-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-common - 5.5.37-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server - 5.5.37-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-5.5 - 5.5.37-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.37-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-source-5.5 - 5.5.37-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.5.37-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.5 - 5.5.37-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

mysql-client-5.6 - 5.6.16-1~exp1
mysql-client-core-5.6 - 5.6.16-1~exp1
mysql-common-5.6 - 5.6.16-1~exp1
mysql-server-5.6 - 5.6.16-1~exp1
mysql-server-core-5.6 - 5.6.16-1~exp1
mysql-source-5.6 - 5.6.16-1~exp1
mysql-testsuite-5.6 - 5.6.16-1~exp1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.5 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.37-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
mysql-5.6 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.6.16-1~exp1').
